intro: Cayratia palauana, commonly known as the Palau climbing vine, is a tropical plant native to the island of Palau in the western Pacific. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, clustered in small inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible. Cayratia palauana thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along forest edges or in secondary growth areas.
